contentrichtext.text: {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Image |Ship image=[[Image:USS R-24 (SS-101).jpg|300px]] |Ship caption=USS ''R-24'' undergoing an [[wikt:overhaul|overhaul]] at the [[Philadelphia Navy Yard]] at [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania|Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]], on 22 September 1923. }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country= |Ship flag= {{USN flag|1945}} |Ship name=USS ''R-24'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= 29 August 1916 |Ship builder= [[Lake Torpedo Boat]], [[Bridgeport, Connecticut]] |Ship laid down= 9 May 1917 |Ship launched= 21 August 1918 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= 27 June 1919 |Ship decommissioned= 11 June 1925 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= 9 May 1930 |Ship renamed= |Ship reclassified= |Ship homeport= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honors= |Ship fate= Sold for scrap, July 1930 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox Ship Characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= [[United States R class submarine|R class]] [[submarine]] |Ship displacement={{convert|495|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} surfaced<br/>{{convert|598|LT|t|0|abbr=on}} submerged |Ship length= {{convert|175|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam= {{convert|16|ft|8|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draft= {{convert|13|ft|11|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship depth= |Ship hold depth= |Ship propulsion=[[Diesel-electric]] |Ship speed={{convert|14|kn|lk=in}} surfaced<br/>{{convert|11|kn}} submerged |Ship range= |Ship test depth= |Ship complement=29 officers and men |Ship armament=• 4 × {{convert|21|in|mm|0|abbr=on}} [[torpedo tube]]s<br/>• 1 × [[3"/50 caliber gun]] |Ship armor= |Ship notes= }} |} '''USS ''R-24'' (SS-101)''' was an [[R class submarine|''R''-class]] coastal and harbor defense submarine of the [[United States Navy]]. Her keel was laid down on 9 May 1919 by the [[Lake Torpedo Boat]] Company of [[Bridgeport, Connecticut]]; the R-boats built by Lake Torpedo Boat (R-21 through R-27) are sometimes considered a separate class from those built by [[Fore River Shipbuilding]] (R-1 through R-14) and [[Union Iron Works]] (R-15 through R-20). She was [[ship naming and launching|launched]] on 21 August 1918 sponsored by Mrs. Edmund R. Norton, and [[ship commissioning|commissioned]] on 27 June 1919 with Lieutenant Commander Andrew C. Bennett in command. ==Service history== After four months of coastal operations off southern [[New England]], ''R-24'' got underway for her homeport, [[Coco Solo]], [[Panama Canal Zone]], on 1 November. Based there for her active service she was given [[hull classification symbol]] SS-101 in July 1920 and at the end of 1921 she returned to the [[United States]] for a shipyard overhaul. In the fall of 1922, she resumed operations out of Coco Solo and [[Balboa, Panama|Balboa]]. A year later she again sailed to the United States for a shipyard overhaul and at the end of 1924 she returned for inactivation. On 25 January 1925, she arrived at [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]], and on 11 June she was decommissioned after only five-and-a-half years of service. ''R-24'' was berthed at [[League Island]] for the next five years. On 9 May 1930 she was struck from the [[Naval Vessel Register]] and in July was sold for scrapping. == References == *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/r1/R-24.htm}} ==External links== * {{navsource|08/08101|USS R-24}} {{United States R class submarine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:R-24 (SS-101)}} [[Category:Ships built in Connecticut]] [[Category:United States R-class submarines]] [[Category:1918 ships]] {{US-submarine-stub}}
